availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Theodosia Younger. Father of John Younger, Mary Ann Younger, Maria Jean Younger", Davies Younger, Claudius Clarendon Younger, Evaline Younger, and Luella Younger. Farmer in Hancock County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Hancock County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 102-103.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 9.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Hancock County, KY, July and August 1863, p. 24, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
"Democratic Meeting in Hancock County," Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky.), September 8, 1866.
Find A Grave, "George Madison Younger," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=119937133&ref=acom), (accessed on April 5, 2017).
